title: How to Make Soup in 20 Minutes

steps.headline: Have in your house some large cans of chicken broth, and a few of the ingredients listed in "Ingredients."
steps.description: Other than the broth, you do not need to have all the things, just some of the things.

steps.headline: Start heating the broth.
steps.description: Pour one or two large cans of chicken broth into a large pot on the stove, and turn the heat on high.

steps.headline: Slice the kielbasa.
steps.description: Slice it into pieces about a quarter inch (0.5 cm) thick or so. You might want to slice the rounds into half-rounds. Put the cut-up sausage into the pot as soon as you are done cutting it, and give it a stir.

steps.headline: Add the hard vegetables.
steps.description: Begin peeling and cutting up the following: carrots, celery, potatoes (1-inch cubes), turnips, cabbage. Add them to the pot as soon as you're done. Give it a stir.

steps.headline: Add the medium-hard vegetables.
steps.description: Begin peeling and cutting up the following: squash (1-inch cubes), potatoes (1/2-inch cubes), frozen spinach (if frozen in a block).

steps.headline: Add loose frozen vegetables.
steps.description: Add frozen peas, corn, loose-leaf spinach, beans.

steps.headline: Add herbs.
steps.description: Add some parsley (1-2 tablespoons), black pepper (1/2 teaspoon), thyme (1/2 teaspoon), or whatever else you like.

steps.headline: Stir and heat until done.
steps.description: Stir the soup, and get the frozen vegetables mixed in well. Heat until just bubbling.

text: Have in your house some large cans of chicken broth, and a few of the ingredients listed in "Ingredients." Other than the broth, you do not need to have all the things, just some of the things. Start heating the broth. Pour one or two large cans of chicken broth into a large pot on the stove, and turn the heat on high. Slice the kielbasa. Slice it into pieces about a quarter inch (0.5 cm) thick or so. You might want to slice the rounds into half-rounds. Put the cut-up sausage into the pot as soon as you are done cutting it, and give it a stir. Add the hard vegetables. Begin peeling and cutting up the following: carrots, celery, potatoes (1-inch cubes), turnips, cabbage. Add them to the pot as soon as you're done. Give it a stir. Add the medium-hard vegetables. Begin peeling and cutting up the following: squash (1-inch cubes), potatoes (1/2-inch cubes), frozen spinach (if frozen in a block). Add loose frozen vegetables. Add frozen peas, corn, loose-leaf spinach, beans. Add herbs. Add some parsley (1-2 tablespoons), black pepper (1/2 teaspoon), thyme (1/2 teaspoon), or whatever else you like. Stir and heat until done. Stir the soup, and get the frozen vegetables mixed in well. Heat until just bubbling. Eat!
